intro: Phialacanthus griffithii, commonly known as the Indian horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking, spurred petals that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant produces bright orange or red flowers that bloom in late summer. It has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Papaveraceae family.
